summary: The Federal Firearms Licensee Protection Act of 2025 seeks to amend chapter 44 of title 18 of the United States Code. The bill focuses on enhancing penalties for the theft of firearms from licensed federal firearms dealers. It increases the prison sentences for those who knowingly violate or attempt to violate section 922(u), especially if the theft occurs during a burglary or robbery, with minimum sentences tied to the nature of the crime and also addresses licensed collectors.
